alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for employees' computers
overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers loaning computers to employees
title: Expenses and benefits: computers loaned to an employee

table.body:
As an employer loaning computers to your employees, you have certain National Insurance and reporting obligations.

^If you loaned a computer to an employee before 6 April 2006 and this arrangement is still in place, different rules may apply - read [technical guidance](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim21699.htm "Particular benefits: computers: partial exemption"){:rel="external"} from HMRC.^


*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: Overview

table.body:
You don't have to report or pay anything to HMRC if either of the following apply:

- the employee earns [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year 
- the computer is provided for work purposes and the employee doesn't make ['significant' private use](/http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM21613.htm "what is significant private use"){:rel="external"} of it


*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: What's exempt

table.body:
If the computers you loan to employees aren't [exempt](/expenses-and-benefits-computers-loaned-to-an-employee/whats-exempt "what is exempt"), you must report them to HMRC and pay National Insurance.

##Computers available for private use

For employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year, or directors:

* report on form P11D, section L
* pay Class 1A National Insurance on the [value of the benefit](/expenses-and-benefits-computers-loaned-to-an-employee/work-out-the-value "value of the benefit")

*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: What to report and pay

table.body:
If you need to [report or pay National Insurance](/expenses-and-benefits-computers-loaned-to-an-employee/what-to-report-and-pay "What to report and pay") on the benefit, work out the value by following these steps:

s1. Calculate 20% of the greater of either the computer's market value at the time you provided it, or any rental charge you pay for it.
s2. Add any running costs that you cover.
s3. Take away any amount that your employee contributes to cost of the loan.
